member.summary: Gets an instance object from storage.

application identifier which is unique within an organisation
unique id of the party that is the owner of the instance
unique id to identify the instance
member.returns: the instance

member.name: M:Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.InstancesController.Post(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of an application in platform storage. Clients can send an instance as json or send a multipart form-data with the instance in the first part named "instance" and the prefill data in the next parts, with names that correspond to the element types defined in the application metadata. The data elements are stored. Currently calculate and validate is not implemented.
member.param: unique identifier of the organisation responsible for the app
application identifier which is unique within an organisation
unique id of the party that is the owner of the instance
member.returns: the created instance

member.name: M:Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.InstancesController.PostSimplified(System.String,System.String,Altinn.App.Api.Models.InstansiationInstance)
member.summary: Simplified Instanciation with support for fieldprefill
member.param: unique identifier of the organisation responsible for the app
application identifier which is unique within an organisation
instansiation information
member.returns: The new instance

member.name: M:Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.InstancesController.AddCompleteConfirmation(System.Int32,System.Guid)
member.summary: Add complete confirmation.
member.remarks: Add to an instance that a given stakeholder considers the instance as no longer needed by them. The stakeholder has collected all the data and information they needed from the instance and expect no additional data to be added to it. The body of the request isn't used for anything despite this being a POST operation.
member.param: The party id of the instance owner.
The id of the instance to confirm as complete.
member.returns: Returns the instance with updated list of confirmations.

member.name: M:Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.InstancesController.UpdateSubstatus(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Guid,Altinn.Platform.Storage.Interface.Models.Substatus)
member.summary: Allows an app owner to update the substatus of an instance.
member.param: unique identifier of the organisation responsible for the app
application identifier which is unique within an organisation
The party id of the instance owner.
The id of the instance to update.
The new substatus of the instance.
member.returns: Returns the instance with updated substatus.

member.summary: Deletes an instance.
member.param: The party id of the instance owner.
The id of the instance to delete.
A value indicating whether the instance should be unrecoverable.
member.returns: Returns the deleted instance.

member.name: M:Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.InstancesController.GetActiveInstances(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves all active instances that fulfull the org, app, and instanceOwnerParty Id combination.

application identifier which is unique within an organisation
The party id of the instance owner.
member.returns: A list of light weight instance objects that contains instanceId, lastChanged and lastChangedBy (full name).

member.name: M:Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.InstancesController.ExtractInstanceTemplate(Altinn.App.Api.Helpers.RequestHandling.MultipartRequestReader)
member.summary:
Extracts the instance template from a multipart reader, which contains a number of parts. If the reader contains only one part and it has no name and contentType application/json it is assumed to be an instance template.
If found the method removes the part corresponding to the instance template form the parts list.
member.param: multipart reader object
member.returns: the instance template or null if none is found

member.name: T:Altinn.App.Api.Infrastructure.Filters.AutoValidateAntiforgeryTokenIfAuthCookieAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is part of the anti request forgery system.

member.name: P:Altinn.App.Api.Infrastructure.Filters.AutoValidateAntiforgeryTokenIfAuthCookieAttribute.Order
member.summary: Gets the order value for determining the order of execution of filters. Filters execute in ascending numeric value of the property.

remarks.para: Filters are executed in a sequence determined by an ascending sort of the property.

The default Order for this attribute is 1000 because it must run after any filter which does authentication or login in order to allow them to behave as expected (ie Unauthenticated or Redirect instead of 400).
Look at for more detailed info.

A reference to the current app settings.
